subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|わき}}

Nominalization of verb {{m|ja|分く|tr=waku||to split, to divide}}, from the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem form}} of ''waki''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Came to refer to the space between where two things split off from each other, and then, by extension, came to refer to the side of something.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|わき}} # {{lb|ja|sort=わき|anatomy}} the [[armpit]], the [[underarm]] #* {{w2|ja|梶井基次郎}}{{w2|ja|pref=『|桜の樹の下には|suf=』}} #*: {{ja-usex|[[おまえ]]は'''腋'''の[[下]]を[[拭く|拭い]]ているね。[[冷汗]]が[[出る]]のか。|おまえ は '''わき''' の した を ふいている ね。ひや.あせ が でる の か。|I see you are wiping your '''armpit'''. Cold sweat?}} # the [[underarm]] area of [[clothing]] # the [[side]] of something (this sense may also be spelled {{ja-l|傍}} or {{ja-l|側}}). #: {{ja-usex|'''脇'''から口を出す|'''わき''' から くち を だす|“to put one's mouth in from the '''side'''” → to jump into a conversation}} #* {{quote-journal |lang=ja| |year=2003 |author={{lang|ja|川本三郎}} (Saburō Kawamoto) |title={{lang|ja|高層ビルの足元にムラがある}} (''Kōsō Biru no Ashimoto ni Mura ga Aru'', “Villages at the Feet of Skyscrapers”) |magazine={{lang|ja|風の旅人}} (''Kaze no Tabibito'', “Wind Travelers”) |publisher=[http://www.eurasia.co.jp/ Eurasia Travel Co., Ltd.] |location=[[w:Tōkyō|Tōkyō]] |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=OdhHKOt56eEC&lpg=PA103&dq=%E3%83%93%E3%83%AB%E3%81%AE%E8%84%87&pg=PA103#v=onepage&q=%E3%83%93%E3%83%AB%E3%81%AE%E8%84%87&f=false |accessdate=2013-06-17 |volume=5 |isbn=9784901919081 |page=103 |passage=大きなビルの'''脇'''には、小さな飲食店が並ぶ昔ながらのマーケットのような町が残っている。|tr=おおきなびるのわきには、ちいさないんしょくてんがならぶむかしながらのまーけっとのようなまちがのこっている。
''Ōkina biru no '''waki''' ni wa, chīsana inshokuten ga narabu mukashi nagara no māketto no yō na machi ga nokotte iru.'' |translation=To the '''side''' of large buildings, streets remain that are like old-time markets, with rows of small restaurants.}} # a [[tangent]], such as in a [[conversation]] #: {{ja-usex|話題から'''脇'''へそれてしまう|わだい から '''わき''' へ それて しまう|“to wander away from the topic and off onto a '''tangent'''” → to stray off-topic}} # something in a [[secondary]] and [[supporting]] role: ## in ancient Japan, an [[assistant]] to the {{m|ja|春宮坊|tr=Tōgūbō|pos=rank title; responsible for administering eastern provinces}} ## in the [[medieval]] period, old name for {{m|ja|関脇|tr=sekiwake|pos=sumō rank}} ## in {{m|ja|能楽|tr=nōgaku||[[Noh]] theatre}}, the [[supporting]] [[role]] played alongside the main [[protagonist]] ## in {{m|ja|浄瑠璃|tr=jōruri|pos=recitation accompanying a puppet show}}, the supporting [[reciter]] ## in {{m|ja|邦楽|tr=hōgaku|pos=traditional Japanese music}}, the [[accompaniment]] # something of lesser importance, something on the [[back burner]] (often used in constructions such as {{lang|ja|脇に}}{{ja-l|する}} (''waki ni suru'', “to put off to the side”), {{lang|ja|脇に}}{{ja-l|なる}} (''waki ni naru'', “to become off to the side”).) # short for {{ja-l|脇能||wakinō}}: a type of [[Noh]] theatre, performed first in a series of performances, wherein a god or spirit prays for a peaceful [[reign]] for the [[emperor]] # short for {{ja-l|脇句||wakiku}}: the two seven-[[syllable]] lines of [[poetry]] following the {{m|ja|発句|tr=hakku|pos=the first three lines of a ''[[renga]]'', of 17 syllables and later serving as the ''[[haiku]]'' form}} # short for {{ja-l|脇百姓||wakibyakushō}}: lower-ranking [[commoner]]s in the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]] and earlier # somewhere, someone, or something [[else]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
Idioms
Synonyms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かたわら}}

Alteration from ''katahara'' ({{ja-l|片腹}}, “side of the belly, one's sides”), coming to mean the [[side]] of something.

subSections.title: Adverb
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|adverb|かたわら|hhira=かたはら}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=かたわら|傍ら||[[besides]]; [[while]]}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|かたわら|hhira=かたはら}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=かたわら|傍ら||the [[side]] of something; a place [[nearby]]; a [[person]] nearby; the area [[alongside]] something; a [[remote]] partially [[built-up]] area along a major [[highway]]}}
